Hi David,

I guess I could write my own wrapper but I was hoping someone ha=
d
already invented this wheel for log4j.

At the moment, I can programmatic=
ally control logging so my test classes
are turning off logging when they r=
un. It works but not ideal.

Thanks

Rakesh

-----Original Message-----
Fro=
m: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of
David =
Saff
Sent: 29 September 2005 19:45
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [=
junit] Replacing Logger class


Rakesh,

Would it be possible, rather than =
making calls directly against the 
log4j classes, to call thin wrappers tha=
t you control, that you can turn

off during testing?

    David Saff

Rake=
sh Patel wrote:

> Hi All,
>
> Does anyone know how to disable log4j loggin=
g when running tests. 
> Reading through Junit in Action (excellent btw) it=
 shows an example 
> where code is refactored in such a way that the Logger=
 is actually 
> mocked out. Unfortunately, I cannot see how to do this with=
 log4j 
> since it is a class rather than an interface.
>
> Any help apprec=
iated!
>
> Thanks
>
> Rakesh
>
> PS I am using the 1.3 alpha release versio=
n of log4j which has a bug -

> logger creation always logs even when you t=
urn logging off.
